protocol_name: Script R7: Intra and Inter Personal Dissimilarity
protocol_name_html: Script R7: Intra and Inter Personal Dissimilarity
description:
This protocol outlines the analysis used for intra and interpersonal diversity of the virome and whole metagenome using the Bray Curtis dissimilarity metric. We visualize the differences as bar plots and calculate the statistical significance of the differences using a t-test. Based on the methods from the following publication:

Hannigan, Geoffrey D., et al. "The Human Skin Double-Stranded DNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome." mBio 6.5 (2015): e01578-15.
protocol_affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

components.data: Now we need to format the data and generate a dissimilarity matrix using the Bray-Curtis metric. We will use this matrix to extract the dissimilarity values between our samples below.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now we need to format the data and generate a dissimilarity matrix using the Bray-Curtis metric. We will use this matrix to extract the dissimilarity values between our samples below.

components.data: Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time points (2 and 3).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time points (2 and 3).

source_data.name:
SUBSET_MAP <- INPUT_MAP[-which(INPUT_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID %in% NA), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[which(SUBSET_MAP$TimePoint %in% c(2,3)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$Site_Symbol %in% c("Ba","Ph","Vf","Neg")), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID %in% c(2,3,9,11)), ]

components.data: Get only the samples described in the map subset.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get only the samples described in the map subset.

source_data.name:
KEEP_SAMPLES <- as.vector(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID)
INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_NO_FINAL[which(INPUT_NO_FINAL$ContigID %in% c(KEEP_SAMPLES)), ]
row.names(INPUT_SUBSET) <- INPUT_SUBSET[,1]
INPUT_SUB_FORMAT <- INPUT_SUBSET[,-1]
head(INPUT_SUB_FORMAT)[,c(1:6)]

components.data: Generate distance matrix using Bray Curtis for all time points (2 and 3).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Generate distance matrix using Bray Curtis for all time points (2 and 3).

components.data: We need to obtain a data frame with all of the distance information between specific combinations of sample distances. Intrapersonal dissimilarities will be between the same location and subject, but at time point 2 vs 3. Interpersonal distance will be between the sample and any other given sample of that time point.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We need to obtain a data frame with all of the distance information between specific combinations of sample distances. Intrapersonal dissimilarities will be between the same location and subject, but at time point 2 vs 3. Interpersonal distance will be between the sample and any other given sample of that time point.

components.data: Get intrapersonal and interpersonal distance similarities, showing intra over time is more similar than that site compared to all other sites.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get intrapersonal and interpersonal distance similarities, showing intra over time is more similar than that site compared to all other sites.

components.data: ## No id variables; using all as measure variables
components.name: Expected result

source_data.result: ## No id variables; using all as measure variables

components.data: Get intrapersonal values in same format.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get intrapersonal values in same format.

source_data.name:
INTER_TP3_MELT$Type <- "Inter"
INTRA_TRANS <- data.frame(t(INTRAPERSONAL_DIST))
INTRA_TRANS_CUT <- INTRA_TRANS[,c("X1","X4")]
INTRA_TRANS_CUT$Type <- "Intra"
colnames(INTRA_TRANS_CUT) <- c("variable","value","Type")
INTRA_TRANS_CUT$value <- as.numeric(as.character(INTRA_TRANS_CUT$value))
row.names(INTRA_TRANS_CUT) <- NULL

components.data: Bind together all of these data frames.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bind together all of these data frames.

source_data.name:
BOUND_DIST <- rbind(INTRA_TRANS_CUT, INTER_TP2_MELT, INTER_TP3_MELT)
BOUND_DIST <- BOUND_DIST[,c(2,3)]
head(BOUND_DIST)

components.data:

## 2   0.6270453   Intra
## 3   0.3861310   Intra
## 4   0.6064570   Intra
## 5   0.8635676   Intra
## 6   0.8629480   Intra
components.name: Expected result

components.data: Plot the resulting distances as means with standard error.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plot the resulting distances as means with standard error.

source_data.name:
BOUND_SUMMARY <- ddply(BOUND_DIST, c("Type"), summarise, N=length(value), mean=mean(value), sd=sd(value), se=sd/sqrt(N))
head(BOUND_SUMMARY)

components.data:
##   Type   N   mean   sd   se
## 1   Inter   30504   0.7217809   0.1400811   0.0008020493
## 2   Intra   124   0.6310340   0.1350353   0.0121265309
components.name: Expected result

components.data: Visualize the data as a nice blue bar plot.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Visualize the data as a nice blue bar plot.

source_data.name: ggplot(BOUND_SUMMARY, aes(x=Type, y=mean)) + theme_bw() + geom_bar(position=position_dodge(), stat="identity", fill="lightblue") + geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=mean-se, ymax=mean+se), width=.2, position=position_dodge(.9))

components.name: Expected result

components.data: Perform a t-test to determine the statistical significance of the difference between the two populations.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform a t-test to determine the statistical significance of the difference between the two populations.

components.data:
##
## Welch Two Sample t-test
##
## data: BOUND_DIST$value by BOUND_DIST$Type
## t = 7.467, df = 124.08, p-value = 1.264e-11
## alternative hypothesis: true difference in means is not equal to 0
## 95 percent confidence interval:
## 0.0666928 0.1148010
## sample estimates:
## mean in group Inter mean in group Intra
## 0.7217809 0.6310340
components.name: Expected result

source_data.result:
##
## Welch Two Sample t-test
##
## data: BOUND_DIST$value by BOUND_DIST$Type
## t = 7.467, df = 124.08, p-value = 1.264e-11
## alternative hypothesis: true difference in means is not equal to 0
## 95 percent confidence interval:
## 0.0666928 0.1148010
## sample estimates:
## mean in group Inter mean in group Intra
## 0.7217809 0.6310340

components.data: Finally, look at the temporal variation using the Jaccard Similarity Index.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Finally, look at the temporal variation using the Jaccard Similarity Index.

source_data.name:
BOUND_DIST$simlr <- 1- BOUND_DIST$value
BOUND_DIST_SUB <- BOUND_DIST[c(which(BOUND_DIST$Type %in% "Intra")),]
JaccardPlot <- ggplot(BOUND_DIST_SUB, aes(x=Type, y=simlr)) + theme_classic() + geom_jitter(position = position_jitter(width = .2))

JaccardPlot

components.name: Expected result
